definition: erhua variant of 費勁|费劲[fei4 jin4]

sentences.english: The injured man levered himself up on his elbow.
sentences.chinese: 受伤者靠肘部费劲地抬起身子。

sentences.english: The boss won’t bother scolding you if he wants to fire you.
sentences.chinese: 他说，“如果老板要炒你鱿鱼，就不会费劲去责骂你。

sentences.english: The calculation was difficult but we finally cracked it.
sentences.chinese: 计算起来很费劲，然而我们终于解出来了。

sentences.english: Ordinarily they were able to rack up all the other teams without the lightest effort.
sentences.chinese: 按说他们可以毫不费劲地击败其他各队。
我罟数学学起来很费劲。

sentences.english: The eldest built his house with straw, because he thought it is easy to do.
sentences.chinese: 老大用稻草来盖房子，因为他觉得这样不会太费劲。

sentences.english: Women scrambled to safely through smoke-filled alleyways.
sentences.chinese: 女人们费劲地穿过烟雾弥漫的小巷寻找安全区域。

sentences.english: What puzzles us is why you would bother to borrow $5,000?
sentences.chinese: 儰啥您哙卟怕费劲莱这借5000元呢？

sentences.english: The wounded soldier levered himself up on his elbow and shouted for help.
sentences.chinese: 伤兵用肘费劲地支起身子大声呼救。

sentences.english: Jack was wounded in the legs. He levered himself up on his elbow and shouted for help.
sentences.chinese: 杰克双腿受了伤，他用肘费劲地支起身子大声呼救。

sentences.english: Alice said to herself, as well as she could for sneezing.
sentences.chinese: 爱丽丝费劲儿地对自己说，并不停地打着喷嚏。

sentences.english: Three thousand pounds! he could spare so considerable a sum with little inconvenience.
sentences.chinese: 三千镑呀，我可以毫不费劲地省出这么一笔巨款。

sentences.english: You may become demanding, in which case you could allow self-centeredness that deepens relationship inhibitions.
sentences.chinese: 你会以自我为中心而变得费劲，加深了关系中的压抑。

sentences.english: Only 2 cents a quote, I did a two-night, really was hard.
sentences.chinese: 一帖才2毛钱，我做了两个通宵，确实很费劲。

sentences.english: Trying to get the silverware clean we have to exert ourselves to rub away for hours.
sentences.chinese: 为把银器擦亮，我们必须花几个小时很费劲地擦拭。

definition: to expend a great deal of effort
erhua variant of 費勁|费劲[fei4 jin4]
troublesome/to take a lot of trouble to do sth
to entail strenuous effort/to toil at a task/strenuous/laborious/strain
to spend effort/to take trouble/May I trouble you to...? (as part of polite request)/Please would you mind...?

pinyin: jiu3 niu2 er4 hu3 zhi1 li4

definition: to take a lot of trouble (over sb or sth)/may I trouble you (to do sth)
tired/weary/to strain/to wear out/to work hard
to accumulate/to involve or implicate (Taiwan pr. [lei4])/continuous/repeated
to worry/to feel anxious/Taiwan pr. [zhao1 ji2]
